title: Crude Oil Prices Drop Further
text:
16:23 CET Crude Oil Prices Drop Further By Daily Guide 
The prices of crude oil on the international market dropped to record low yesterday. Owing to the development, the relevant authorities in the country could review prices of petroleum products this weekend. 
As of 5:26 pm yesterday, Brent crude oil was selling at $53.76 a barrel while WTI crude oil sold at $49.10. 
Projections from the International Monetary Fund (IMF) and other international energy firms further suggest that crude oil prices could even fall further to about $40 a barrel before the end of year. 
The drop in the prices of crude oil on the world market could lead to a reduction in the price of petroleum products on the Ghanaian market. 
However, the Oil Marketing Companies (OMC) would have to make the necessary computations to alleviate the suffering of consumers. 
With recent forecast suggesting that the Ghana cedi would stabilize in the coming weeks, prices of petroleum products at the pumps could go down substantially this weekend in line with price deregulation. 
The development is expected to affect government's projected revenue from the sector substantially. 
The recent drop in crude oil prices, for instance, forced government to revise its expected revenue from the sector from GH¢4.5 billion to GH¢1.8 billion for this year. 
Consumers would have to assess the impact of low crude oil prices on projects that are being funded with the oil revenue and the country's economy in general. 
By Cephas Larbi
